intro: Thaleropia hypargyrea, commonly known as the silverleaf thaleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it blooms during the summer months. Thaleropia hypargyrea is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
